text:
and ﬁle naming conventions. The input data is in CSV format where columns are separated by
whitespace. Each of these ﬁles can be loaded as a NumPy array. The load file() function
below loads a dataset given the ﬁle path to the ﬁle and returns the loaded data as a NumPy
array.
# load a single file as a numpy array
def load_file(filepath):
dataframe = read_csv(filepath, header=None, delim_whitespace=True)
return dataframe.values
Listing 24.1: Example of a function for loading a single ﬁle.
